A Theory T in a first order language L is Model-Complete if every 1 285 Definition BMT-d004 /Users/connorlockhart/Documents/GitHub/ModelTheoryWiki/monster-main/trees/Basic Model Theory/BMT-d004.tree BMT-d004.xml 2024 2 8 Morgan Bryant Embedding of L-structures
Given two structures in a language \mathcal {L} \mathcal {A} and \mathcal {B}, an embedding \varphi : \mathcal {A} \rightarrow \mathcal {B} is a homomorphism such that:
For every n-ary relation R \in \mathcal {L}, for all a_1, \dots , a_n \in A, \varphi (R^{ \mathcal {A}}(a_1, \dots , a_n)) \text { holds } \Leftrightarrow R^{ \mathcal {B}}( \varphi (a_1), \dots , \varphi (a_n)) holds
This is stronger than a homomorphism because we now require a two way implication in the above property. between L-structures which are models of T is an elementary embedding.
